       9             : #include "mozilla/ServoBindingTypes.h"
      10             : #include "nsRuleNode.h"
      11             : 
      12             : namespace mozilla {
      13             : 
      14             : // Tagged union between Gecko Rule Nodes and Servo Computed Values.
      15             : //
      16             : // The rule node is the node in the lexicographic tree of rule nodes
      17             : // (the "rule tree") that indicates which style rules are used to
      18             : // compute the style data, and in what cascading order.  The least
      19             : // specific rule matched is the one whose rule node is a child of the
      20             : // root of the rule tree, and the most specific rule matched is the
      21             : // |mRule| member of the rule node.
      22             : //
      23             : // In the Servo case, we hold an atomically-refcounted handle to a
      24             : // Servo ComputedValues struct, which is more or less the Servo equivalent
      25             : // of an nsStyleContext.
      26             : 
      27             : // Underlying pointer without any strong ownership semantics.
      28             : struct NonOwningStyleContextSource
      29             : {
      30             :   MOZ_IMPLICIT NonOwningStyleContextSource(nsRuleNode* aRuleNode)
      31           0 :     : mBits(reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(aRuleNode)) {}
      32             :   explicit NonOwningStyleContextSource(const ServoComputedValues* aComputedValues)
      33           0 :     : mBits(reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(aComputedValues) | 1) {}
      34             : 
      35             :   bool operator==(const NonOwningStyleContextSource& aOther) const {
      36             :     MOZ_ASSERT(IsServoComputedValues() == aOther.IsServoComputedValues(),
      37             :                "Comparing Servo to Gecko - probably a bug");
      38             :     return mBits == aOther.mBits;
      39             :   }
      40             :   bool operator!=(const NonOwningStyleContextSource& aOther) const {
      41             :     return !(*this == aOther);
      42             :   }
      43             : 
      44             :   // We intentionally avoid exposing IsGeckoRuleNode() here, because that would
      45             :   // encourage callers to do:
      46             :   //
      47             :   // if (source.IsGeckoRuleNode()) {
      48             :   //   // Code that we would run unconditionally if it weren't for Servo.
      49             :   // }
      50             :   //
      51             :   // We want these branches to compile away when MOZ_STYLO is disabled, but that
      52             :   // won't happen if there's an implicit null-check.
      53           0 :   bool IsNull() const { return !mBits; }
      54           0 :   bool IsGeckoRuleNodeOrNull() const { return !IsServoComputedValues(); }
      55             :   bool IsServoComputedValues() const {
      56             : #ifdef MOZ_STYLO
      57             :     return mBits & 1;
      58             : #else
      59             :     return false;
      60             : #endif
      61             :   }
      62             : 
      63             :   nsRuleNode* AsGeckoRuleNode() const {
      64             :     MOZ_ASSERT(IsGeckoRuleNodeOrNull() && !IsNull());
      65           0 :     return reinterpret_cast<nsRuleNode*>(mBits);
      66             :   }
      67             : 
      68             :   const ServoComputedValues* AsServoComputedValues() const {
      69             :     MOZ_ASSERT(IsServoComputedValues());
      70           0 :     return reinterpret_cast<ServoComputedValues*>(mBits & ~1);
      71             :   }
      72             : 
      73             :   bool MatchesNoRules() const {
      74           0 :     if (IsGeckoRuleNodeOrNull()) {
      75           0 :       return AsGeckoRuleNode()->IsRoot();
      76             :     }
      77             : 
      78             :     // Just assume a Servo-backed StyleContextSource always matches some rules.
      79             :     //
      80             :     // MatchesNoRules is used to ensure style contexts that match no rules
      81             :     // go into a separate mEmptyChild list on their parent.  This is only used
      82             :     // as an optimization so that calling FindChildWithRules for style context
      83             :     // sharing is faster for text nodes (which match no rules, and are common).
      84             :     // Since Servo will handle sharing for us, there's no need to split children
      85             :     // into two lists.
      86             :     return false;
      87             :   }
      88             : 
      89             : private:
      90             :   uintptr_t mBits;
      91             : };
      92             : 
      93             : // Higher-level struct that owns a strong reference to the source. The source
      94             : // is never null.
      95             : struct OwningStyleContextSource
      96             : {
      97             :   explicit OwningStyleContextSource(already_AddRefed<nsRuleNode> aRuleNode)
      98           0 :     : mRaw(aRuleNode.take())
      99             :   {
     100             :     MOZ_COUNT_CTOR(OwningStyleContextSource);
     101             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!mRaw.IsNull());
     102             :   };
     103             : 
     104             :   explicit OwningStyleContextSource(already_AddRefed<ServoComputedValues> aComputedValues)

     106             :   {
     107             :     MOZ_COUNT_CTOR(OwningStyleContextSource);
     108             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!mRaw.IsNull());
     109             :   }
     110             :

     112           0 :     : mRaw(aOther.mRaw)

     114             :     MOZ_COUNT_CTOR(OwningStyleContextSource);
